Description: One of a pair of large gold earrings. Within a hoop in the form of a two-headed snake are two hounds and two monkeys. Pendants of alternating discs and owls hang from the hoop.
Curator's comments: Made on Crete. or by immigrant Cretan craftsmen on Aegina. May have been inspired by Egyptian jewellery. Pair with 1892.5-20.13.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (763)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2008-2009 18 Nov-15 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, 'Beyond Babylon: Art, Trade, and Diplomacy in the Second Millennium B.C.' 2018 27 Mar-9 Sep, Los Angeles, Getty Centre, Egypt-Greece-Rome: Cultures in Contact
